newsitem.title: ITALY: Generali Italy premiums up 10pct Jan-April.
newsitem.headline: Generali Italy premiums up 10pct Jan-April.

text.p: Generali's written premiums in Italy rose 10 percent in the first four months of 1997, the company said in a statement issued at its annual shareholders' meeting on Saturday.
The company said life insurance premiums rose 13 percent between January and April while individual policies climbed 19 percent.

Non-life premiums rose eight percent over the same period, of which car insurance climbed six percent and non-car business 10 percent. Generali said it expected a six to eight percent increase in non-life premiums for the whole of 1997.
Italy's largest insurer said invesment income totalled 352 billion lire in the opening four months of the year, up 12 percent on the same period in 1996. -- Rome newsroom +396 6782501
